meanings.definition: One of two poles with platforms for the feet, used for walking above wet ground or water.
meanings.sent1: The circus performer walked gracefully on the stilt.
meanings.sent2: She practiced balancing on the stilt to cross the stream.
meanings.sent3: The stilt made the clown look taller and funnier.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was a stilt that lifted him above his fears.
meanings.sent5: The stilt creaked under his weight as he tiptoed across the pond.

meanings.definition: A long, slender supporting column or column-like supporting structure.
meanings.sent1: The bird perched on the stilt of the dock.
meanings.sent2: The old house had stilts to keep it above the floodwaters.
meanings.sent3: The stilt stood tall and proud in the marshland.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the stilt that held up her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The stilt supported the weight of the entire structure with ease.
